page.title: 07MANX SHEARWATERS ON RHUM
page.content: The cuillin of{Rhum}provide breeding grounds for c.100,000 pairs of burrow _nesting{Manx Shearwaters.}These nocturnal seabirds first return to Rhum from their{wintering grounds off {S.America}in March & by May are ready to lay their{single white eggs.}Both parents take turns in incubating the egg in the safety of their burrow over about 50 days. The downy chicks are fed a rich diet of small fish so that by about 55 days old they are heavier than their parents! Fledglings finally leave their burrows when about 70 days old to begin the long flight to the wintering grounds. Young birds first {return to the breeding grounds when {2_4 years old & spend progressively {longer periods at the colony during {succeeding summers before first breed {_ing when 6 or more years old.}Manx Shearwaters may live for over 25 years
